course_description: The course will encompass a survey of the governmental policies, court cases, statutes, regulations, treaties, and executive orders that together have set the legal framework between the U.S. government and the 574 sovereign tribal nations currently recognized under federal law. It will chart the historical development of Federal Indian Law beginning with the jurisprudence of the Marshall Court and continuing to the contemporary era of tribal self-determination and nation-building. Included within the curriculum will be discussion of issues such as land rights, criminal jurisdiction, gaming, religious freedom, and international law. Attendance will be mandatory for all classes.
